description: Massive underground cavern containing ancient ruins and a Poneglyph. Accessed by falling through a sink hole in the Sandora Desert. The structure is unstable and begins collapsing shortly after discovery.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Underground Ruins
keyEvents.description: Zoro, Luffy, and Chopper accidentally fall into the underground ruins through a sink hole.
keyEvents.significance: First discovery of hidden ancient ruins in the anime outside of known archaeological sites.

keyEvents.title: Poneglyph Discovery
keyEvents.description: The trio discovers a Poneglyph within the underground ruins - the first Poneglyph appearance in the anime.
keyEvents.significance: Historic moment introducing Poneglyphs to anime viewers, though in a non-canon context.

keyEvents.title: Escape from Collapsing Ruins
keyEvents.description: The ruins begin to collapse and the trio escapes using Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Zenmai technique.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the unstable nature of the ancient structure.

statusHistory.description: Discovered by Luffy, Zoro, and Chopper

significance: First underground ancient ruins discovered in the anime. Contains the first Poneglyph shown in the One Piece anime, though this is non-canon filler content. Demonstrates that there are hidden archaeological treasures throughout the world.

trivia.fact: This location is anime-only and does not appear in the manga, making it non-canon.
The Poneglyph found here is the first shown in the anime, predating the canon Poneglyph discovery in Arabasta's Tomb of the Kings.
The ruins collapse shortly after discovery, ensuring they cannot be revisited or further explored.

description: A vast desert region in Arabasta that the Straw Hats must cross to reach Alubarna. Known for its extreme heat, dangerous wildlife like Sandora Lizards, and hallucinogenic Mescal Cacti.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Eats Mescal Cactus
keyEvents.description: Luffy consumes a psychoactive cactus found in the desert, causing hallucinations.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the natural hazards present in the Sandora Desert.

keyEvents.title: Vivi's Conversation with Nami
keyEvents.description: While traveling through the desert, Vivi discusses her fears about her kingdom with Nami.
keyEvents.significance: The desert journey provides time for character development and philosophical discussions.

significance: The harsh desert environment creates challenges for the crew and provides the backdrop for both comedic moments (Luffy's hallucinations) and serious character development (Vivi's worries, crew bonding).
